intro: Chrysocyathus apenninus, commonly known as the Apennine yellow cup, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Cyathaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
